file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 23-22-03-04 - ACARS CONFIGURATION MODULE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ACARS CONFIGURATION MODULE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH ACARS 1. General A. This section contains the procedures to remove/install the ACARS configuration module. B. The ACARS configuration module is a serially connected EEPROM designed to store the ACARS configuration data. C. The ACARS configuration module is installed in the ACARS mounting tray. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH ACARS CONFIGURATION MODULE - RE- 23-22-03-000-801-A ACARS MOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH ACARS CONFIGURATION MODULE - IN- 23-22-03-400-801-A ACARS STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 23-22-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-22-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH ACARS 2. ACARS CONFIGURATION MODULE - REMOVAL A. General This task gives the procedure to remove the ACARS configuration module. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 23-22-01-000-801-A/400 ACARS UNIT - REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-62-01-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 214 113CZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY M81969/14-01 Inserter/Extractor Pin insert/extract E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the 113CZ access door (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). NOTE: Make sure that landing gear safety pins are installed. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, on the cockpit ceiling, make sure that circuit breakers below are open: • ACARS (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/COMM/ACARS). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-22-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • FMS 2 (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/FMS 2). • AHRS 2 (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/AHRS2). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the ACARS unit from the mounting tray (5) ( AMM TASK 23-22-01-000-801-A/ 400). (2) Remove the FMS 2 computer from the mounting tray (AMM TASK 34-62-01-000-801- A/400). (3) Remove the AHRS 2 from the mounting tray (AMM TASK 34-21-01-000-801-A/400). (4) Remove the screws that attach the electrical connector (1) to the mounting tray (5). (5) Remove the screws that attach the mounting tray (5) to the structure. (6) Carefully pull the mounting tray (5) to get access to the configuration module (3). (7) Remove the nuts (2) that attach the configuration module (3) to the mounting tray (5). (8) Using the pin extractor, remove from the electrical connector (1), the connector's pins of the configuration module (3). (9) Remove the configuration module (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-22-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH ACARS ACARS Configuration Module - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 214 DET. A 3. CONFIGURATION 4. SCREW 2. NUT MODULE 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 5. MOUNTING TRAY DET. B 145AMM230160.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-22-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-22-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH ACARS 3. ACARS CONFIGURATION MODULE - INSTALLATION A. General This procedure gives the instructions to install the ACARS Configuration Module. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - ACARS - FUNCTIONAL TEST WITH A PORTABLE AMM TASK 23-22-00-700-801-A/500 ACARS TEST STATION(PATS) AMM TASK 23-22-01-400-801-A/400 ACARS UNIT - INSTALLATION ACARS CONFIGURATION MODULE - PROGRAM- AMM TASK 23-22-03-860-801-A/200 MING AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400 AHRS COMPUTER - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 34-62-01-400-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 214 113CZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY M81969/14-01 Inserter/Extractor Pin insert/extract E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Using the pin inserter, insert the configuration module (3) pins on the electrical connector (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-22-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Install the configuration module (3) on the mounting tray (5). (3) Tighten the nuts (2) that attach the configuration module (3) to the mounting tray (5). (4) Tighten the screws that attach the electrical connector (1) to the mounting tray (5). (5) Tighten screws that attach the mounting tray (5) to the structure. (6) Install the ACARS unit into the mounting tray (5) ( AMM TASK 23-22-01-400-801-A/ 400). (7) Install the FMS 2 computer into the mounting tray (AMM TASK 34-62-01-400-801-A/ 400). (8) Install the AHRS 2 into the mounting tray ( AMM TASK 34-21-01-400-801-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the 113CZ access door (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, on the cockpit ceiling, close the circuit breakers below: • ACARS (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/COMM/ACARS). • FMS 2 (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/FMS 2). • AHRS 2 (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/NAV/AHRS2). (3) Proceed an ACARS configuration ( AMM TASK 23-22-03-860-801-A/200). (4) Do the ACARS functional test ( AMM TASK 23-22-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-22-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
